Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the risk of China-made Holi festival decorations being infected with the novel coronavirus.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that China-made Holi festival decorations are infected with the novel coronavirus.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Chinese items used during the Holi festival are heavily infected with the novel coronavirus.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations, such as the low likelihood of imported goods remaining infectious on arrival to India.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Toy Association of India have stated that it is safe to receive goods from China and that the virus does not survive long on objects.
